reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful! 3 star purely due to size. Should be luxury 4 star!!
reviews.title: Elegent & Simple

reviews.text: My fiancee and I came across this little gem whilst visiting the old town a few days prior.
reviews.title: Perfect peace
Small but elegant and cosy
reviews.text: As we were looking for somewhere to stay for the night we remembered Vila Sao Vicente. As you walk into reception you are greeted with tastefully decorated wall fixings and rugs upon the typical marble floors. We quickly realised that this was a small and sophisticated hotel (Hotel ruins the image and i like to think of it more of a Villa) with, i believe, 15 rooms where two members of staff run the show.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights in July 2010.
reviews.title: Highly recommend - had a wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: excellent, a 5 minute walk to the elevator to the beach, a 10 minute walk to the main area with restaurants/shopping, there’s also a bus stop a block up from the hotel
reviews.title: TOP QUALITY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms/amenities: the décor was nice, spacious we had TV, A/C, huge armoire (could even store both suitcases in it) the bathroom had a proper shower and was nice, no issues with water temperature or water pressure. The room was very clean, bed was comfortable. There’s a nice patio/deck with sun loungers, and you can have the buffet breakfast out there in the morning, sea views as well.
reviews.title: best hotel ever.

likes.disliked: — could not find fault with anything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall: we ended up staying here because the accommodations we originally booked, despite a handful of positive reviews on tripadvisor, were unacceptable to us. We just walked by this hotel and popped in, viewed the room in advance, and then booked it for our last two nights in Albufeira. Wow, what a difference, this hotel became our oasis, and one of our favorites of the trip – it really salvaged our trip to Albufeira. Front desk staff were friendly/helpful. Would love to stay here again.
reviews.title: Quiet and lovely

likes.liked: — Hard to choose from many great things! But probably the location.
likes.disliked: — Can't think of anything, actually. Oh yes, the bathrooms were tiny.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Suggestions: As we found with Lagos, Albufeira is quite touristy, so it was difficult to find decent food. However, well worth a visit is the Villa Joya restaurant. It’s about a 10 Euro cab ride away, two Michelin star restaurant, it’s not cheap (155 Euros per person for dinner), but worth every penny. Make reservations in advance. Beautiful outdoor seating, with the roar of the ocean in the background.
reviews.title: Small is lovely

likes.disliked: — The bar and lounge closed at 10 30
